gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Welcome to Thoughtmarks - your second brain

content.whatAreThoughtmarks:
**What Are Thoughtmarks**
Thoughtmarks are your saved ideas — quick notes, quotes, or snippets of insight.
Each one captures a single thought so you can connect them later into bigger patterns.
content.quickCapture:
**Quick Capture**
Tap the + button to create a new Thoughtmark instantly.
Or say "Siri, add a Thoughtmark" on your Apple iPhone or with a paired Apple Watch for a hands-free note.
content.types:
**Types of Thoughtmarks**
Text, voice, or link — anything that sparks a thought. Voice-to-Thoughtmark notes transcribe automatically to make capture a breeze!
content.organization:
**Organization**
Use Bins to group Thoughtmarks by theme, project, or mood.
Search or filter by tags to surface what matters fast.

content.create:
• Tap any Thoughtmark to edit or expand.
• Long-press to pin, share, or move between bins.
• Use filters (All, pinned, ideas, etc.) to focus on one category at a time.

content.whatAreBins:
• Create bins for "Projects," "Reading," or "Podcast Ideas."
• Add Thoughtmarks by tag or drag-and-drop.
• Tap ••• to rename, reorder, or delete a bin.

content.voiceRecording:
• Tap the mic tab to start recording.
• Watch app recordings sync automatically and convert to text.
• Review, edit, or tag the transcription just like a normal Thoughtmark.

content.smartSuggestions:
• Use Insights to reveal themes across your notes.
• Tap Related to see how different Thoughtmarks link together.
• Ask questions in natural language: "What were my ideas about creativity last week?"

content.quickSearch:
• Type keywords, phrases, or tags.
• Use filters like text only or voice notes.
• Recent searches appear automatically for quick recall.

content.appearance:
• Choose light or dark mode, or follow system.
• Manage account and premium plan.
• Configure privacy, backup, and data export options.

content.quickCapture:
• Try tagging your Thoughtmarks with verbs — read, watch, build — for better filtering.
• Add a quick Thoughtmark from the widget or watch app to never lose an idea.
• Review pinned notes at the start of your day.
